learningObjectives: Write numbers up to 1 million in digits and words
Understand place value in large numbers

concept.introduction: Let's explore how to read and write really big numbers! Numbers can get huge - up to 1 million and beyond. Once you understand the pattern, it becomes much easier.
keyPoints: Every digit has a place value - units, tens, hundreds, thousands, etc.
Numbers are read from left to right in groups of three digits
Commas help us separate groups of thousands to make reading easier
The position of each digit tells us its value

examples.title: Reading 234,567
examples.description: Let's break down this 6-digit number step by step
examples.explanation: This reads as 'two hundred thirty-four thousand, five hundred sixty-seven'

visualAids.title: Place Value Chart for Large Numbers
visualAids.description: A chart showing millions, thousands, and units columns

guided.introduction: Let's practice reading and writing large numbers together, step by step.

stepByStepExamples.title: Reading the number 456,789
stepByStepExamples.problem: How do we read the number 456,789?

steps.instruction: Start from the left and identify the thousands
steps.explanation: The first three digits represent thousands

steps.instruction: Next, identify the hundreds, tens, and units
steps.explanation: The last three digits are just like a regular 3-digit number

steps.working: 456 thousand + 789 = Four hundred fifty-six thousand, seven hundred eighty-nine
steps.explanation: We combine the thousands and units parts with proper language

stepByStepExamples.finalAnswer: Four hundred fifty-six thousand, seven hundred eighty-nine
stepByStepExamples.explanation: We read large numbers by breaking them into groups of three digits from right to left

interactiveElements.title: Place Value Practice
interactiveElements.description: Drag digits to their correct place value positions
interactiveElements.activity: Students drag digits into a place value chart

checkpoints.question: What does the digit 5 represent in the number 152,847?
checkpoints.explanation: The 5 is in the ten thousands place, so it represents 50,000
hints: Look at the position of the digit

independent.introduction: Now it's your turn! Practice reading and writing large numbers on your own.

practiceProblems.question: What is 468,291 written in words?
options: Four hundred sixty-eight thousand, two hundred ninety-one
Four thousand, six hundred eighty-two, ninety-one
Forty-six million, eight hundred twenty-nine thousand, one
Four hundred sixty-eight, two hundred ninety-one
practiceProblems.correctAnswer: Four hundred sixty-eight thousand, two hundred ninety-one
hints: Break the number into thousands and units
The comma separates thousands from units

practiceProblems.question: Write 'Three hundred thousand, forty-five' as a number.
hints: Remember to include zeros for missing place values

selfCheckQuestions: Can you read any 6-digit number confidently?
Do you understand what each digit position represents?
Can you write numbers from words without help?

extensions.title: Number Detective
extensions.description: Find large numbers in newspapers or online and practice reading them

assessment.introduction: Time to show what you know about large numbers!

questions.question: In the number 924,681, what is the value of the digit 4?
questions.explanation: The 4 is in the thousands place, so its value is 4,000

questions.question: Which number is largest?
questions.explanation: 1 million is larger than any 6-digit number

questions.question: Write the number seven hundred thousand, two hundred in digits.

learningObjectives: Read and write numbers up to 10 million
Round large numbers to appropriate places

concept.introduction: Now that you've mastered numbers to 1 million, let's explore even bigger numbers - up to 10 million!
keyPoints: The millions place comes before thousands
We still group digits in threes for easier reading
Place value pattern continues: millions, thousands, units
Commas separate each group of three digits

examples.title: Reading 5,234,567
examples.explanation: This reads as 'five million, two hundred thirty-four thousand, five hundred sixty-seven'

guided.introduction: Let's practice with even larger numbers, building on what you already know.

stepByStepExamples.title: Reading 7,825,943
stepByStepExamples.problem: How do we read this 7-digit number?

steps.explanation: The leftmost digit is in the millions place

stepByStepExamples.finalAnswer: Seven million, eight hundred twenty-five thousand, nine hundred forty-three
stepByStepExamples.explanation: We read each group separately, adding the appropriate place value words

checkpoints.question: In 3,456,789, what does the 3 represent?
checkpoints.explanation: The 3 is in the millions place
